subject: Re: [junit] Re: About the value of JUnit
msgSnippet: ... So you haven t used it professionally yet. ... Good. ... I read a lot about the problems of (insert anything here). ... Opinions are like assholes.
messageBody:
>So said javainsel on 4/4/2003 --------------------
>> Serious question: how can you compare JTest and JUnit when you
>admit that you haven't used JUnit?
>
>I use JUnit since one week.

So you haven't used it professionally yet.

>I didn't use JTest but I will test it.

Good.

>I read a lot about the problems of JUnit/TDD.

I read a lot about the problems of (insert anything here).

>Although I'm new to testing solutions like JUnit/TDD I have enough
>knowledge to establish an own
>opinion about that.

"Opinions are like assholes. Everyone has one."

>Maybe I change my opinion. But I am not so blind to overlook all the
>problems concerning JUnit/TDD.

Everything has problems. Life is about deciding which problems you can live with.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
